job.title: Research Engineer
job.description:
Interchain GmbH is a 19-person company which works on core blockchain technology. We are based in Berlin, but our team stretches from New York City to Ulyanovsk, Russia. We keep in touch through Slack and Zoom, and get together in person periodically (when COVID permits).

We are searching for a Research Engineer who will serve as part of an interdisciplinary team applying scientific principles to discover, analyze, and design complex socio-technical and economic systems meeting high level descriptive goals using tools from an array of disciplines from multi-agent control to mechanism design. The Engineer is responsible for developing and documenting mathematical models based on requirements from internal and external stakeholders. The Engineer will use formal analysis techniques to design and refine economic models by characterizing evolutionary tendencies and attack vectors, as well as using stochastic process simulations to explore system trajectories and define practical bounds on system parameters. The Engineer will have opportunities to present work to technical and non-technical audiences, both publicly and privately.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Capture and document descriptive models of economic systems from whitepapers, conference calls, and in person meetings and characterize as formal goals
  • Extend formal models with complete notation and assumptions and characterize analytically the immediate consequences of these definitions and assumptions
  • Propose and Evaluate incentive mechanisms to align local agent goals with system level goals
  • Create simulation tools for dynamical systems representing the evolution of economic systems at various levels of detail, from agent-based to macroeconomic
  • Use simulation tools to run repeated stochastic process-driven numerical experiments for a wide range of environmental conditions and behavioral assumptions
  • Use data analysis tools to evaluate experimental results and make recommendations regarding the assumptions and conditions under which a particular set of mechanisms and/or policies will achieve the stated goals of the economic system
  • Use data analysis tools to evaluate data collected directly from economic networks to verify that the intended dynamics are emerging, and to recommend tuning system parameters as needed
  • Support the design and development of economic health indicators and operational analytics
  • Provide reports and/or requirements documents to stakeholders
  • Document work in a structured format to serve as a manual for software implementation

REQUIREMENTS:

  • M.S. or higher in Engineering, Robotics, Operations Research, Economics or related field
  • Masters Level Course work in Optimization and/or Decision Science
  • 4+ years research experience in Industry or Academia
  • Advanced Numerical Computing skills (Matlab, Python, R)
  • Advanced Mathematical Analysis skills (ability to write formal proofs)
  • Proficient with a scripting language
  • Proficient with data manipulation and visualization
  • Proficient with LaTeX or Markdown for mathematical documentation
  • Proficient with collaborating in a technology team setting (GitHub, Jira)
  • Good presentation and communication skills in English—visual and verbal
  • Ability work with a heterogeneous team to achieve a common goal

job.title: Senior SRE (DevOps)
job.description:
We are building the world's premier Operational Intelligence platform for Blockchain. We strive to develop our systems by observing the best practices of our craft; this means building redundant, performant, secure and scalable systems, while at the same time enabling our company to deliver the best services and products it can to its customers.

These are the early days of our platform, and as a Senior SRE you will be able to contribute, influence and take ownership in significant parts of our systems. Our goal is to build a very high performance platform, capable of analysing thousands of transactions across multiple blockchain networks in real-time. We have a hybrid-cloud platform in the making, optimizing for cost, security and the scalability/elasticity of our platform.

If you are a Senior SRE with a solid understanding of linux, containers, kubernetes, distributed systems, automation and would love to work with a geographically distributed team, join us!


What this position is all about:

  1. Designing, deploying, maintaining and managing our hybrid-cloud infrastructure, using IaC, configuration management and automation. We hate routine tasks with a passion!
  2. Working under a Scrum or Kanban framework and being responsive in dealing with the needs of the team
  3. Owning your work. This means working alongside developers to contribute ideas, suggestions, code on security, automation, scaling, CI/CD, testing, data pipelines. We are one team working on a number of services.
  4. Understanding, participating and contributing to the company goals, regardless of your role. Metrika is a small company with a very inclusive culture. We are looking for people that share those values with us.

Please note: Our Engineering team is predominantly based in Europe. This position is currently open to those resident and currently able to work in the European Economic Area (EU, Norway, Liechtenstein), Switzerland, the UK as well the eastern United States/Canada (UTC-4/UTC-5 timezone)

  1. A bachelor's degree in Computer Science. Masters or higher degrees preferred.
  2. At least 4 years of experience in designing and maintaining production-grade, cloud native, asynchronous/event-based microservices-based or serverless infrastructure.

  4. Expertise in linux system administration, *nix system design.

job.title: Technical Recruiter
job.description:

We operate the world’s largest network of Crypto ATMs. Our next-generation terminals have made it So Flippin’ Easy to purchase and sell cryptocurrency. Skip the long onboarding times of traditional exchanges and join the revolution. It's not too late.

We are a profitable cryptocurrency-based startup, and we’re growing at an exciting pace. We’re seeking a Technical Recruiter responsible for identifying, recruiting, screen, and presenting good candidates for technology positions, collaborating with hiring managers to set realistic technical requirements.

Are you the type of person that would love the challenge and thrill of joining an early-stage startup? Are you passionate about cryptocurrency, and eager to drive adoption in this space? Do you love engaging with employees, processes and culture? Look no further!

We are very intentional about our hiring process and employee experience. Culture is super important to us - and we aim to build a top-performing, diverse team who all enjoy working and innovating together. We have lots of great things in the works and a plan of action to deliver industry-leading crypto and fintech products to our ever-growing user base. 

Join us on our journey to being a leader in the crypto space! 

Primary Responsibilities
  • Write and post technical job descriptions
  • Source potential candidates on niche platforms, like Stack Overflow and Github

  • Participate in tech conferences and meetups to network with IT professionals

  • Keep up-to-date with new technological trends and products

  • Proven work experience as a Technical Recruiter or Recruiter

We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you require an accommodation, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

job.title: Senior Product Designer
Trading Systems Developer (C++)
Senior Software Engineer
job.description:
At River Financial we have made a commitment to building financial solutions that power a radically more transparent and efficient global economic system made possible by Bitcoin. To that end, we have built leading Bitcoin brokerage and custody products to keep our clients ahead of the curve. We now aim to bring to the world premier Bitcoin banking solutions that offer a full array of financial services for our clients. We are looking for people to help build the future of the Bitcoin economy at River Financial. 

When hiring, we look for candidates who demonstrate the ability to think clearly, communicate effectively, and get things done. We value people who are able to think and build for the future without forgetting the lessons of the past. 

We are looking for a senior candidate who is comfortable across the entire web stack and has experience building and maintaining production systems at scale. This person will be building features that our clients use every day. Example projects might include: leading the development of a new financial service or account type, building novel performance reporting features, implementing Yubikey authentication, or building account security tooling to help keep our clients safe. Our web stack consists primarily of Elixir and JavaScript. We rely on Postgres for data storage and RabbitMQ for communication with our Bitcoin backend, written in Go.

What you will be doing
  • Architect and develop new features and products in the Elixir codebase powering our web applications and API
  • Work closely with product management to plan and scope new projects and initiatives
  • Write high-quality, tested code
  • Participate in code-reviews
  • Help shape the culture of the engineering organization for years to come
  • Mentor junior engineers

    • What we look for in you
  • 5+ years of experience in software engineering
  • You have designed, built and maintained production services at scale and understand how to build reliable systems
  • You write high-quality, reliable code and take ownership of systems you work on
  • You have experience developing solutions to ambiguous problems
  • You're excited about what we are building at River
  • You have a solid understanding of web security fundamentals

    • Nice to haves
  • Fintech experience
  • You have worked with Elixir, Kubernetes, Postgres
  • You have worked at a rapidly scaling company
  • Interest in Bitcoin

job.title: Fullstack Engineer
job.description:
About Messari

Messari is an analytical platform on a mission to organize and contextualize information for crypto professionals. With Messari, analysts and enterprises can analyze, research, and stay on the bleeding edge of the crypto world while trusting the transparency of the underlying data. This gives professionals the power to make informed decisions and the ability to take timely action.

Our users range from some of most prominent analysts, investors, and crypto individuals to top platforms like Coinbase, BitGo, Anchorage, 0x, Chainanalysis, Ledger, Compound, MakerDAO and many, many more.


About the Web3 Engineer role

We are looking for an experienced web3 engineer to join as a member of the core engineering team. As a web3 engineer, you will have an extensive impact over the product, the UI/UX, and the technology.

Our platform is a single-page web application used to contextualize crypto information. It is built using React, TypeScript, Material UI, and GraphQL.

As a member of the team, you will be responsible for
  • adding Web3 interaction while providing an intuitive user experience - for e.g. sending transactions to smart contracts is hard to grasp, can we find a way to visualize it in a way such that novices can make sense of it?
  • building a dynamic UI to provide easy to digest information with varying levels of granularity, from educating a user on a given asset to interacting with on-chain contracts
  • implementing new interaction workflows - our product is constantly growing, so how do we build exciting new workflows while keeping products cohesive?
  • maintaining a high bar for code quality, reusability, and readability
  • collaborating with product, research, and design to create a useful and delightful user experience

    • About You
  • 3+ years experience with modern front-end technologies including React and TypeScript
  • curiosity in Web3 technologies like web3.js and ethers.js and have tinkered in this space
  • a passion for shipping high-quality product that delights users
  • looking to work on big/interesting things with lots of creative freedom
  • have experience with building products and/or have the curiosity to think through the holistic product picture
  • interest in the crypto space, and a love for building tools that help users dive deep into this world
  • empathetic and love to help your teammates grow

    • Nice-to-haves
  • worked with other elements of our tech stack: Node, GraphQL, Postgres, Golang
  • specific experience with building dApps and/or applications of security through on-chain integrations

    • Projects you could work on
  • Web3!– Integrate with a specific smart contract and create a UI which facilitates the on-chain interaction and build it into the product workflow
  • GraphQL!– Surface web3 data by building GraphQL integrations and surfacing the data into an intuitive UI
  • Custom Components! - Create custom components to unlock specific on-chain workflows leveraging wallet integrations and on-chain metrics pulling

    • What’s it like to work at Messari?
  • A welcoming and open environment with people who love to collaborate on ideas and tackle complex problems
  • Work with a small team of engineers with large impact across product, research, and business development
  • Participate in forums like Family Meals and Messari Lab to share ideas and technologies you’ve been exploring and tinkering with
  • Enjoy awesome, comprehensive benefits; unlimited PTO; and the ability to work remotely
    • Our commitments
    Messari is committed to maintaining a workplace where diversity of identity, culture, and life experience is the norm and respected consistently. Diversity of experience drives creativity and innovation, entrepreneurial leadership and integrity, and competitive and collaboration throughout our business and in the market. We depend on our differences to make our team stronger, and have our product reflect the diversity of our customers.

    At Messari, we welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, socioeconomic status, religion, age, marital or parental status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.description:
Ledn provides financial products with a mission to help clients across the globe unlock the power of digital assets to build wealth for the long term. Active in over 100 countries and exceeding $1 billion in assets on its platform, Ledn provides simple, transparent, and secure financial service products that help people save, earn, and borrow on their digital assets.

Ledn is backed by world-class global investors including Alan Howard, Alexis Ohanian, CMT Digital, Coinbase Ventures,  Global Founders Capital, Hashed, John Pfeffer, Kingsway Capital, ParaFi Capital, Susquehanna Private Equity Investments LLLP, and White Star Capital’s Digital Asset Fund.

The Opportunity

As an owner of Ledn, each team member has an adaptive role in a fast-paced progressive environment where their voice contributes to the team and growth.

As a Full Time Senior Software Engineer, your main responsibilities will be to develop and build out our architecture. You will provide solutions for high priority projects and take ownership of projects. You will be end-to-end from building, creating, implementing, testing and maintaining. You are a builder and love to write code, create, work autonomously, think through architecture, and provide solutions with the Engineering team to improve our business automation and streamline our client journey. You will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer and be an integral part of the team.

About This Role
  • Full-stack, you are comfortable with front-end and back-end and everything in between, but have a true passion for back-end.
  • You will be in build and design mode and get to create. You will own projects such as our mobile development with React Native, build out our architecture, and propose solutions. 
  • You will see your projects in production in no time and participate in client calls so you experience the impact of your work and build exactly what our clients need.
  • You will have a low ego. We're a flat team here at Ledn and the best ideas win!

    • What You Bring To Ledn
  • 4+  years of practical software engineering experience.
  • Extensive experience with AWS ( Lambda, API Gateway, Cognito, AppSync, CloudWatch and CloudTrail, SQS, SNS).
  • Practical Node.js experience requiredJavascript, Typescript, & GraphQL are your strongest languages.
  • Experience with MongoDB or NOSQL preferred.
  • React & React Native with practical experience building out code with our tech stake required.
  • Understanding of application infrastructure (serverless) and continuous development.
  • Knowledge of blockchain technology is another important aspect to successfully manage and enhance business operations.
    • A Taste of What We Provide

    * As one of Canada’s leading digital asset companies we provide tremendous growth opportunities
    * A career that provides you with purpose in your job. We remove barriers so you love what you do.
    * Team-based organizational structures that reinforce problem solving, decision making, and team work.
    * Here at Ledn we all have ownership in the company.
    * Competitive benefit packages and competency based compensation structures

    We are an equal opportunity employment organization and pride ourselves on inclusivity, diversity, and the success that comes from diversity. Please check us out on LinkedIn to get to know the team.

    Please note, due to the high volume of applications, only those applicants that qualify will be contacted.

    It's COVID, where are you working?
    We're all working remote until Fall 2021. After that, if and when it's safe to do so, we'll return to an office in downtown Toronto. We've learned a lot working remotely and are pretty good at it, but also miss connecting and collaborating with our team!

  • Conduct regular client check-ins or meetings to ensure a recurring opportunity to touch base with customers.

Additionally: The successful candidate will support a growing number of clients and cultivate relationships by:

  • Ability to identify and resolve the issues on the spot to ensure that flow of work proceeds smoothly.

Join an awesome company entering a hyper-growth phase

job.title: Content Manager (Remote Optional)
Full Stack Software Engineer
job.description:
Description

At Reserve, we’re changing the Venezuelan financial system to allow access to US dollars. Dollar access is crucial to our users in order to cope with ongoing hyperinflation. We’re roughly 2/3 Venezuelan and 1/3 US American, funded by Sam Altman and Peter Thiel personally, and spread across North and South America. Before Reserve, our team members led two of the most prominent attempts to solve the problem of hyperinflation in Venezuela.

We’ve created a series of tubes that allows any normal Venezuelan to convert their Bolivars (the local failed currency) into US dollars and back again in our app in a couple of minutes. This means that Venezuelans can use our app to easily save and spend in US dollars, and not have to worry about their money devaluing overnight. Because of the capital controls in Venezuela, this kind of financial service is not commonly available, and our early users are extremely appreciative of what we’ve built. New users are often skeptical we can deliver on what we say our app does until they try it, and often evangelize to their friends once they have seen it work.

This is the percentage of users that are still actively using the service after N weeks from their first time trying it


Our near-term ambition is to support the entire Venezuelan economy transacting digitally in US dollars, escaping the issues posed by the hyperinflation our country has suffered for the last decade.

In the long term, Reserve aims to eliminate hyperinflation globally, by offering the same service in other countries and eventually launching a currency that’s independent of the US dollar. But, let’s not get carried away, one step at a time! Right now we are aiming to serve 10M+ Venezuelans, and we’re looking at Argentina next. Reserve is ultimately a cryptocurrency project, but right now what we are doing is more like Cash App meets BitTorrent.

Why we’re hiring

Despite all we have going for us (yes, we are proud!) our app still sucks in various ways. As we write this, we have a long waitlist of would-be users who are getting impatient with us (publicly – like, accumulating 1-star reviews from people who are upset that they are still waiting to get in 😬). We aren’t able to let them join, because of the challenges we face in scaling the series of tubes referenced above. We have pretty clear plans for how to scale, but there are still puzzles to handle and we’re sure there will be unexpected twists and turns. Until recently, we’ve been mostly product– and research–oriented, understanding our users and settling on what our app needs to offer.

Now that our early adopters are loving us and evangelizing, we need to grow our engineering team to deliver the same level of service to a much larger audience.

So, we urgently need your creative, driven, articulate, altruistic mind to thoughtfully and efficiently grok these challenges, reach clear solutions, and – sometimes on your own and sometimes with a team – implement them. We’re willing to compete with Amazon/Google/Apple/Netflix on compensation in order to hire the absolute best people we can find, because we just have to get this right, and because we have the cash treasury to comfortably do so, having done very well in the crypto markets. So, we can offer an unusual degree of job security along with the impact, challenge, and potential financial upside of being a relatively early startup.

Our engineering team

Our small engineering team consists of two US Americans, two Argentinians, and one Venezuelan. Including two ex-Googlers, one 20-year founder/contractor-type, an early blockchain dev, and a recent grad. Some of us are part of the Effective Altruism / AGI sphere, and all of us care a great deal about clear thinking, doing good work, and getting things right.

This is us. Venezuelans on our team typically stay anonymous.

We’ve read Paul Graham, Peter Thiel, Scott Alexander, Ray Dalio, Nick Szabo, Greg Egan, Isaac Asimov, Douglas Hofstadter, Daniel Kahneman, Eliezer Yudkowsky, and Nick Bostrom between us, but we haven’t all read all of them. We recognize that everyone has strengths and weaknesses and we structure our work to cover each other, but we also recognize that the best programmers are indeed 10-100x as productive as the median and we work hard to increase the average effectiveness of our team with each new hire.

We lean towards selecting and using the right tools for the jobs that arise, and we expect our team to learn new tools and skills when the time is right. Our current development stack includes React, React Native, Flask, and Postgres, deployed across Heroku and GCP. We’ve built and deployed smart contracts on Ethereum for custody of the underlying US dollars. Our Ethereum development stack includes Brownie and web3.py, plus a few open-source tools we’ve built ourselves (in Go and Python) for testing, finding code coverage, deploying, and interacting with smart contracts.

Our engineering work hours span from US Pacific Time to Venezuelan time (GMT-4). We use Discord, Zoom, Slack, and Asana. We love Roam, but given recent performance issues we’re using Notion. Our CTO and Head of Product lead our prioritization, and our CEO and COO are deeply involved with the product development process. Our CEO was a self-taught full stack developer long ago, so typically understands our high-level technical considerations.


The full stack role

We’re currently hiring individual contributors and tech leads. All new team members should expect to spend the majority of their time implementing. We hire highly productive engineers with good judgment, which means you need to either be substantially experienced or otherwise unusually skilled in software engineering.

Our current and upcoming work includes:

  • mobile and web user interfaces
  • back-end services
  • data and database engineering
  • system architecture

As a full stack engineer, you will:

  • work on the Reserve mobile app and associated web portal, front and back end
  • build in React Native, React.js, and Flask (Python)


The kind of engineers we hire

We’re very excited about you if:

  • You take pride in figuring things out and making things work, and once you accept a challenge you enjoy getting into all of the little details and becoming a micro-expert in order to nail it.
  • You can show us cool things you have built yourself in your own time, and/or a long list of projects you’ve had significant ownership over professionally that are related to the work we are doing (mobile, web, smart contracts).
  • You are kind, conscientious, thoughtful, cooperative, and communicative.
  • You have found ways of spending time, effort, or money on improving the world in a meaningful way (i.e. not just virtue signalling, though we don’t mind if you do that too).
  • When we talk to you about something we are building, worrying about, or planning, you quickly understand what we are describing and have productive things to say.
  • You have honed your ability to self-manage, so that when you take on relatively abstract projects you turn them into concrete, sensible plans and bring them to completion -- or if they end up not making sense you realize that quickly and help the team adjust course.
  • You reliably accomplish impressive amounts of important progress on what really matters, whether it’s figuring things out, implementing, educating, evaluating new team members, or anything else that comes up.
  • You prefer the startup life of challenges, uncertainty, invention, chaos, impact, responsibility, and autonomy, over the big-company life of predictability, bureaucracy, clarity, brand recognition, nice offices, and policy.
  • You have enough relevant experience that you can quickly come to solid plans for how to implement whatever you are working on, and your code naturally matches or raises the bar of maintainability we achieve.
  • You understand and appreciate the importance of helping people cope with hyperinflation, either because you have experienced it yourself at some point in your life, or because you are a curious and empathetic intellectual who dives into understanding such things, and are easily sucked into trying to solve humanitarian problems you encounter.


In summary

  • Location: anywhere, but expect to be online for a decent part of the US workday
  • Seniority: both senior and junior engineers are considered, but standards are high
  • Comp: we can match any offer you have, and can do full cash or RSR tokens
  • Stability: we have a large cash treasury, so can offer high job security
  • Purpose: Reserve helps people beat hyperinflation, and aims to eradicate it entirely
  • Language: English native / bilingual proficiency
Requirements Benefits

Our engineering work hours span from US Pacific Time to Venezuelan time (GMT-4). We use Discord, Zoom, Slack, and Asana. We love Roam, but given recent performance issues we’re using Notion. Our CTO and Head of Product lead our prioritization, and our CEO and COO are deeply involved with the product development process. Our CEO was a self-taught full stack developer long ago, so typically understands our high-level technical considerations.


The Ethereum + web3 role

2021 is a big year for Reserve’s blockchain development. First, we are returning to smart contract engineering to implement the full version of the protocol, which includes several features that the current beta version does not. For example, you’d be working with oracles, on-chain auctions, and governance. You’d be working alongside engineers with experience deploying smart contracts, and ideally you’ll have experience with it yourself. But since this space is so new, some of the best candidates will have never touched a smart contract, so if you are hungry to get into smart contract engineering and have the right kind of related experience we are open to teaching you.

We also need to follow the quickly developing Ethereum layer two side-chain space and make a key choice about which one to support in our consumer app. Users need to be able to hold their own private keys and make quick, cheap transactions, without unacceptable reduction in security and decentralization. You might be involved in this research and decision making, as well as implementation of a bridge.

In addition, we will need to build a more elaborate and polished web portal for interacting with the full version of our protocol, to replace the current beta portal.


The kind of engineers we hire

We’re very excited about you if:

  • You take pride in figuring things out and making things work, and once you accept a challenge you enjoy getting into all of the little details and becoming a micro-expert in order to nail it.
  • You can show us cool things you have built yourself in your own time, and/or a long list of projects you’ve had significant ownership over professionally that are related to the work we are doing (mobile, web, smart contracts).

  • When we talk to you about something we are building, worrying about, or planning, you quickly understand what we are describing and have productive things to say.

  • You reliably accomplish impressive amounts of important progress on what really matters, whether it’s figuring things out, implementing, educating, evaluating new team members, or anything else that comes up.
  • You prefer the startup life of challenges, uncertainty, invention, chaos, impact, responsibility, and autonomy, over the big-company life of predictability, bureaucracy, clarity, brand recognition, nice offices, and policy.
  • You have enough relevant experience that you can quickly come to solid plans for how to implement whatever you are working on, and your code naturally matches or raises the bar of maintainability we achieve.
  • You understand and appreciate the importance of helping people cope with hyperinflation, either because you have experienced it yourself at some point in your life, or because you are a curious and empathetic intellectual who dives into understanding such things, and are easily sucked into trying to solve humanitarian problems you encounter.

Description

At Reserve, we’re changing the Venezuelan financial system to allow access to US dollars. Dollar access is crucial to our users in order to cope with ongoing hyperinflation. We’re roughly 2/3 Venezuelan and 1/3 US American, funded by Sam Altman and Peter Thiel personally, and spread across North and South America. Before Reserve, our team members led two of the most prominent attempts to solve the problem of hyperinflation in Venezuela.

We’ve created a series of tubes that allows any normal Venezuelan to convert their Bolivars (the local failed currency) into US dollars and back again in our app in a couple of minutes. This means that Venezuelans can use our app to easily save and spend in US dollars, and not have to worry about their money devaluing overnight. Because of the capital controls in Venezuela, this kind of financial service is not commonly available, and our early users are extremely appreciative of what we’ve built. New users are often skeptical we can deliver on what we say our app does until they try it, and often evangelize to their friends once they have seen it work.

This is the percentage of users that are still actively using the service after N weeks from their first time trying it:

Our near-term ambition is to support the entire Venezuelan economy transacting digitally in US dollars, escaping the issues posed by the hyperinflation our country has suffered for the last decade.

In the long term, Reserve aims to eliminate hyperinflation globally, by offering the same service in other countries and eventually launching a currency that’s independent of the US dollar. But, let’s not get carried away; one step at a time! Right now we are aiming to serve 10M+ Venezuelans, and we’re looking at Argentina next. Reserve is ultimately a cryptocurrency project, but right now what we are doing is more like Cash App meets BitTorrent.

  • building and scaling our order-book exchange, in Python
  • building a framework for automated interaction with 3rd party payment and banking services, using a variety of tools as needed
  • maintaining or building new internal tools we use in smart contract engineering, likely in Go or Python
  • improving scalability of our existing application as our user base grows
  • systems for secret handling and private key management, in order to facilitate client applications accessing private keys, as well as users recovering private keys from cold storage

job.title: Senior Software Engineer - Backend
job.description:
Description

DESCRIPTION

Remember the last time you used an ATM? We were sad too.

How about you join us and rebuild the tech stack of an entire product category?

Join a team who's going through a significant growth phase and scaling our services and team. You have complete autonomy in design, tools and architecture. Ship code fast, get feedback immediately. No layered management, no company politics. Work with a core team of excellent engineers who are passionate about their work.

High Level Requirements:

> Extensive Node.js experience

> Show us something you have designed and built outside of work

> Typescript, mongo & redis experience a plus


We are looking for a remote Canadian-based Senior Software Engineer with deep NodeJS experience to join our core backend team. You'll have the opportunity to build new microservices and help scale our Bitcoin Teller Machine (BTM) cloud-based backend infrastructure. You are highly collaborative and have a passion for mentoring junior/intermediate developers.


##Why Bitaccess?

We’re looking for people who are excited about financial services and cutting-edge technology, and how these together can make a difference in people’s everyday lives.

Cryptocurrency is a transformative technology that will require a re-engineering of the way business as we know it is done. Bitaccess is proud to be a pioneer in this space and is looking for outstanding individuals to join us on this journey.

So if you are ready to join the most fast-paced, exciting, and hectic industry of our generation apply now.

Requirements
  • 5+ years engineering experience
  • 3+ years experience working with NodeJS
  • Experience using statically typed and object-oriented languages (ie TypeScript)
  • Experience with NestJS and an ORM/ODM (eg: Mongoose, TypeORM, MikroORM)
  • Experience building REST or GraphQL APIs
  • Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL databases
  • Comfortable working in a Linux or Unix (macOS) environment
  • Experience writing reliable unit and functional tests


##Good to have

  • Knowledge of AWS or GCP cloud platforms
  • Understanding of distributed systems and building applications at scale
  • Experience with websockets and event driven messaging systems
  • Experience managing junior/intermediate developers

job.title: Executive Assistant
job.description:
This role is currently remote as a result of Covid.   When safe to return to the NY office, where possible, local employees will be given the option for partial onsite return. 


Who we are 

 

We are a trusted, blockchain-native technology team that delivers leading products to address the most complex data challenges. We build SaaS solutions and data services to convert data into auditable information to support management, financial and regulatory reporting. Our products automate and optimize accounting, audit, and tax processes for funds, fund administrators, OTC and proprietary trading firms, exchanges, miners, protocols, and accounting firms - and we are proud to call some of the largest ones our clients.


Who we need 

 

  • 3+ years of relevant experience
  • Practical understanding of IT risk management and security compliance
  • Hands-on experience with audits and control frameworks such as SOC 1, SOC 2, ISO-27001, NIST, etc. 
  • Solid domain knowledge of information security and cyber risks
  • Understanding of cloud controls and environments (AWS)
  • Strong familiarity with Microsoft Office products (specifically advanced ability in Excel)
  • Strong analytical, diagnostic, critical thinking, and project management skills
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize work and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Outstanding written and spoken communication skills
  • Focus on precision and accuracy, and tenacity to clarify ambiguity
  • Highly driven and proactive - keen to create process and structure and strive for continuous improvement
  • Experience in financial services
  • [Nice to have] Understanding of big data, cryptocurrency and/or blockchain
  • [Nice to have] Understanding of financial markets and products
  • [Nice to have] Security certifications e.g. CISA, CISSP, CISM, CTPRP or other 


What you’ll do

 

  • Help manage end-to-end audit process including internal readiness assessments, tracking of remediation efforts to completion, and working closely with auditors to educate them and achieve compliance (e.g., SOC 1, SOC 2, ISO-27001, etc. audits)
  • Liaise between the Risk function and key stakeholders to manage cross-functional risks and ensure compliance with policies and procedures 
  • Regularly review changes in global regulations, standards, and guidelines for information security, cybersecurity, and crypto-specific control frameworks to identify trends and emerging approaches to control validation
  • ​​Create reporting for leadership and key stakeholders to convey status, raise awareness, and enhance the accountability of key risk management programs
  • Drive and monitor the status of remediation activities necessary to mitigate risks and comply with control requirements
  • Implement solutions to help streamline and automate the monitoring, fulfillment, and tracking of control requirements
  • Work closely with auditors to educate them and achieve compliance over IT control environment
  • Complete risk and security due diligence questionnaires from new and potential customers 
  • Help manage and evolve the end-to-end vendor risk management program which includes managing business, security, compliance, financial, and contractual risks associated with working with third-party vendors


Why Join Lukka?


Are you looking for a challenge? Lukka solves the most complex data and technology challenges for an industry that is at the forefront of innovation.


At Lukka, we strive to anticipate and respond to the needs of this new and ever-changing ecosystem of digital assets. That was true in 2014, while everyone was focused on trading & buying this new asset class, we were thinking about the tax implications of crypto. That innovative foresight continues today as we evolve and iterate on our product suite to address the regulations and educate our customers.


We are looking for passionate, collaborative, and strategic individuals who want to help shape the future of, well, everything – starting with making crypto more accountable. We invest in our teammates, promote from within & are responsible to each other by fostering an inclusive space for curious minds to thrive and innovate.


What are some common reasons our team members enjoy working @ Lukka? 


  1. Ability to own the projects they work on
  2. Less red-tape to take ideas from inception to delivery
  3. Being at the forefront of an industry
  4. Small team, big dreams


What’s life @ Lukka like? 


We move fast and continue to be ahead of the curve. You could be part of a growing company bridging the gap between business and blockchain. 

Here’s some insight into why our team members have joined:

  • Ability to own the projects they work on 
  • Less red-tape to take ideas from inception to delivery
  • Being at the forefront of an industry
  • Small team, big dreams


Of course, let’s discuss some perks:


  1. Health and Dental insurance covered at 100% for employees and 70% for dependents
  2. Flexible PTO - burnout is a real thing, we encourage all employees to get out and recharge
  3. Generous Parental Leave - Your growing family is important to you and thus important to us
  4. We work in a rapidly growing industry and we need to also constantly grow. We can’t stay ahead of the curve if we aren’t learning. Every employee is given an annual learning allowance and encouraged to use it
  5. We want you for the long haul. We’re a team on a mission and we want you to grow your career with us. Promoting from within is not just something we say, but something we do
  6. Hard work is rewarded at Lukka. Our recognition programs are designed with you in mind – we provide free crypto to all new employees for learning purposes
  7. Team events - recent nights have included kickboxing, game night, and happy hour!
  8. In-office Fitness Studio - whether you want to lift, meditate or pedal it out on our Peloton; you’ve got the ability to do so


So you’ve scrolled, your interest is piqued and hopefully read all of the important things...now what? 


This is an exciting time to join a team that’s at the forefront of this rapidly growing industry. We are looking for people who constantly push themselves to think differently, are ready to face new challenges and chart exciting new paths. If this excites you, apply now!

job.title: Manager, Product Marketing

job.title: Agile Coach
job.description:
Make our journey, your journey!

An Agile Coach for us means that it is all about empowering the Engineering squads and the wider organization to adopt Agile as a culture shift. The Agile Coach will use their knowledge and skills of the Agile methodology to help Nuri move away from a command and control culture towards a more collaborative one. A key focus of the role will be working with squads and stakeholders to improve the speed and quality of delivery as well as instilling a culture of continual improvement in how we work.

Your mission

  • Coach, teach, mentor and support Engineering squads and other stakeholders to enable them to transition to an Agile way of thinking and working
  • Coach individuals and mentor leadership and Product Managers in order for them to grow and develop and to ensure that we are moving towards an Agile way of thinking and working
  • Promote and enable the transition to Agile by empowering Engineering squads to develop an Agile mindset and way of working
  • Support the wider organisation by implementing Agile process, principles and practices across all levels
  • Work with squads and stakeholders to continuously help identify, diagnose and improve processes
  • Set up, lead and take responsibility for the Agile guild
  • Evaluate, recommend and implement various Agile frameworks and tools to help support teams and stakeholders
  • Assisting with the onboarding of new team members by providing onboarding around our Agile practice

Your profile

  • Strong knowledge and experience with Agile concepts including experience using a combination of lean and Agile practices to help teams succeed and organisations evolve.
  • Experience working in a technology-based start-up where you have been part of an Agile mindset transformation
  • Proven experience in coaching and mentoring Engineering (Development) teams/squads to move towards an Agile mindset and way of working
  • Experience in working with multiple teams and stakeholders to implement and improve Agile practices across various organisational levels from grassroot development and product management through to senior management
  • A genuine passion for helping teams and individuals grow along with a collaborative mindset and approach to improvement
  • Excellent command of the English language - in particular strong English communication and written skills. German fluency is desirable

Why Nuri?

  • You will work on a meaningful, and innovative crypto-banking products to add real value to our customers lives
  • A competitive salary and 28 holidays plus December 24th and 31st
  • We offer flexible ways-of-working, you have the option available to work from our modern office in Kreuzberg, and/or work remotely within Germany. Additionally, we also offer a remote option to work outside of Germany up to 2 months at a time
  • Learning & Development budget of 500 EUR per year
  • M-Membership for Urban Sports Club to enjoy hundreds of indoor, outdoor and wellness activities as well as live classes in Berlin
  • Access to NiloHealth for well-being support and Bitkom that provides plenty of Health & lifestyle benefits and discounts
  • Zero Trading fees to use our products
  • German language courses up until C2 level
  • You will be working with the latest technology along with an agile environment to work as efficiently as possible
  • Bi-weekly break of the week pizza night, TGIF events and one big team event each month

Here, at Nuri, we celebrate a truly diverse and inclusive company culture and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Candidates have 2-5 years of experience in a top-tier law firm and should be familiar with (early-stage) Venture Capital financings and general legal matters. Candidates should be interested in working independently in an entrepreneurial and startup environment. Candidates will be part of the investment team and will be both driving new deals independently (sourcing to closing) as well as working closely with the other members of the team for the execution of their investment opportunities with regards to legal matters.

The position provides the opportunity (and is intended) to be both a Venture Capital Legal Counsel & Investment Manager position in one.

  • Support transactions from inception through closing with regards to legal matters
  • Review of investment documentation and contracts of potential targets
  • Review Data Rooms of potential targets with regard to legal matters
  • Creation of legal contracts and investment documentation for targets
  • Review of investment targets from a legal point of view (incl. completeness check)
  • Portfolio Management for exisiting portfolio companies (with regard to legal and follow-on financing matters)
  • Filing of corporate records and investment documentation from existing and new deals
  • Liaise with the legal counterparts from our different investment vehicles for investments
  • Setup and structuring of potential new investment vehicles
  • Work directly with the Executive Team on general legal matters on a corporate level

Investment Manager / Associate tasks would include the following but are not limited to:

  • Evaluation of new investment opportunities active in Blockchain / DLT (incl. business model analysis, competitor research, and due diligence)
  • Review of business models and financial models of the targets
  • Lead transactions from inception through closing
  • Review documentation and Data Rooms of potential targets
  • Conduct portfolio management for exisiting portfolio companies
  • Work on investor marketing, reporting, and fundraising efforts (incl. fundraising documentation)
  • Contribute to publications/online content and industry events
  • Represent the company at networking events in the blockchain technology / alternative investment industry

Requirements

  • University degree in law [requirement]
  • 2-5 years work experience in a top-tier law firm with focus on Startups and Venture Capital financings
  • Sound knowledge around startup and Venture Capital financing deals
  • Interest in startups and (blockchain) technology

job.title: Blockchain / Full Stack developer to build the Stackchain crypto platform
job.description:
Neco is a stable currency for the common good. For our members, we generate profits, provide universal basic income and protect the climate. Our vision is to build a sustainable financial system that serves the people and the planet.

Tasks

We are looking for an experienced Blockchain / Full Stack developer to build our crypto platform "Stackchain''. Imagine Stackchain as the “Blockchain 2.0” - a faster, more efficient and more secure version of Blockchain technology. Our vision is to build a powerful crypto platform for decentralization and tokenization. Stackchain is the technology powering Neco, the currency for the common good.

Your first project (3 months) will be to develop the MVP (minimum viable product) of Stackchain. Upon successful delivery of the MVP, you have the unique opportunity to receive a long-term development contract, become the lead developer and build your development team. The Stackchain Blue Paper with technical details will be provided.

Requirements

Required experience:

  • Development experience: 5 years or more (Java, JavaScript, Python, Go, Node.js, GitHub)
  • Strong expertise with databases (SQL) and data analytics
  • Blockchain and crypto experience (Bitcoin, Ethereum, smart contracts, encryption)
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud) and deployment (Kubernetes)
  • Experience with agile development (Scrum)
  • Prior experience with other distributed ledger technologies (Corda, Hyperledger) is a plus
  • Prior experience with Google Sheets and Google Apps Script is a plus
  • Prior experience with Web API development is a plus (REST, JSON, XML)
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

Benefits

You can work remotely from any location worldwide and manage your time freely. Our organization is a virtual organization of geographically dispersed teammates collaborating via the internet and video conferences. All teammates are paid according to our performance-based equal payment model called TTT (time, task and team). We pay you for the time you work, the tasks you complete and for good teamwork. We offer great flexibility, unlimited vacation, good pay, exciting projects and an inspiring vision to build the financial system of the future.

We have strong values and high moral standards. We invite experienced developers to join our decentralized collective organization and support our vision to build a sustainable financial system that serves the people and the planet. Apply now to take this opportunity of working on a project that will change the world.

job.title: Developer
job.description:
We are a spin-off from Technische Universität Darmstadt working on cutting-edge technology in the blockchain space. We're currently building our core development team in Darmstadt and are looking for a full-time Go-developer expected to start in July 2019 with a passion for solving complex software challenges.

Perun is a framework of cryptographic 2nd-layer blockchain protocols that addresses the inherent scalability challenges of current blockchain systems. It enables the secure processing of thousands of transactions in real-time supporting complex full-fledged decentralized applications. The protocols are the result of several years of fundamental research conducted jointly by scientists from the Technische Universität Darmstadt and Warsaw University. See perun.network for more details.

Starting in July 2019, we are going to receive funding from the German government to build a development team to implement the Perun protocols. Within the first year, the research project is going to lead to the foundation of a company, of which you could become a founding member. The open-source project Perun thus offers a unique opportunity to advance the implementation of state of the art cryptographic research.

Tasks

  • Implement cutting-edge cryptographic blockchain technology
  • Design of concurrent and complex network applications
  • Write tests for your code
  • Review code
  • Contribute to applied research on blockchain technology

Requirements

  • Strong programming skills (Go, Java, C++, Rust or similar programming languages)
  • Passion for complex software systems
  • Experience in developing networking stacks
  • Experience in designing concurrent applications
  • Experience in collaborative open source projects is a plus
  • Knowledge of cryptographic protocols and blockchain technology is a plus
  • Experience in agile projects using scrum is a plus

Benefits

  • Be part of an exciting open-source project
  • Good engineering practices (testing, CI, reviews, ...) - we love maintainable code
  • Employment by TU Darmstadt according to TV-H pay scale with the possibility to become a founding member of a blockchain startup
  • Learn state-of-the-art technology from experienced blockchain researchers and developers
  • Flat hierarchies & flexible hours
  • Strong contacts to leading figures in the cryptocurrency space
  • Lots of fun

job.title: Product Marketing Manager (Remote Optional)
Head of Field Marketing
job.description:
NYC, SF Bay Area, or US Remote

It’s not very often that a new asset class is born. But that’s exactly what we’re witnessing today with the rise of crypto.

Over just the last four years, crypto has evolved from an embryonic $50B market to a young-but-growing $1T market today. At Bitwise, we think it’s just getting started. In fact, we believe crypto has reached a turning point, and is headed north of $10T over the next few years. Along the way, we expect there to be risks, pitfalls, and uncertainty — much like there was during the rise of the Web, of cloud computing, and of apps. But we also expect there will be great opportunities, and millions of people wanting to participate in the potential upside.

Our goal at Bitwise is to help busy mainstream investors understand and access the opportunities emerging in the cryptocurrency asset class. We want all those who so desire to be able to come along for the ride in a secure and simple manner, and to be able to benefit from the role crypto exposure can play in pursuing their investment objectives.

Today is an exciting moment for Bitwise as a firm. We manage over $1B and are growing quickly, with the largest crypto index fund in the world (ticker: BITW), the first DeFi index fund, and a lot more coming. We focus on serving investment professionals — financial advisors, family offices, hedge funds, endowments, foundations, and others — the people entrusted to look after the capital and savings of individuals and institutions across the country. We provide education, partnership, and professionally managed investment products tailored to this group’s needs, to help them build their view, pick their strategy, and get their exposure.

Currently, Bitwise is a close-knit team of 40 professionals. Our backgrounds combine technology expertise with decades of experience in asset management and indexing, coming from firms including Facebook, Wealthfront, BlackRock, J.P. Morgan, and IndexIQ. We’re backed by some of the most accomplished investors in venture capital and veterans of the financial services world. We love working together, we love what we do, and we’re excited about what’s ahead.

We’re looking for an exceptional individual to join our team and take on important responsibilities to help Bitwise scale. You will report to the Director of Marketing and will own the strategy and execution of Bitwise’s Field Marketing program. There will be a lot to learn, a huge impact to be had, and some lifelong relationships to be built along the way.


What You Will Do

You’ll own Bitwise’s Field Marketing program, with responsibility for driving the strategy and execution of conferences, trade shows, and in-market field events.

You will seek and develop alliances with field marketers in companies within our ecosystem, helping drive the development of joint field marketing programs.

You’ll work cross-functionally across nearly all parts of the business, ensuring there is alignment on priorities and strategy between sales, marketing, investor relations, and the executive team. 

You will partner with Sales and Marketing Operations to develop and drive a data strategy for our field marketing program, including (but not limited to) mapping accounts, segmenting audiences, and incorporating behavioral data.

You will work closely with Marketing Operations to measure and report success, and you will co-own the dashboards that are created. 

You will manage large and complex projects effectively, utilizing your budget and resources wisely to drive real business impact. 

You will plug into the wider marketing community and stay up to date on the latest trends, processes and technologies being used, striving always for a best-in-class field marketing program.


Who You Are

You have 7+ years of professional work experience.

You have 4+ years of experience leading a B2B field marketing program with responsibility for customer conferences, trade shows, and/or in-market field events. 

You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent (with a preference for marketing, communications, and business majors). Your MBA is a plus. 

You have led the planning and execution of at least one multi-day customer conference with at least 150 participants.

You have familiarity with the modern MarTech landscape and how these tools work together to power marketing and sales processes within a B2B environment.

You have proven ability to achieve results working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, customer success, and executive teams. 

You have exceptional time management, organization, and self-motivation abilities. Your work ethic is a source of pride. You know how to prioritize tasks and to deliver projects on time. 

You are a great communicator in writing and conversation, and can convey details with clarity and coherence. You’re an analytical and logic-oriented thinker. 

You are team-centric and care deeply about your relationships with the team internally. 

Your style is like ours: high-energy, positive, caring, deliberate, self-aware, curious and open-minded, inclined to take ownership to get the best outcome but happy to transfer or share ownership with others. You’re proactive in pursuing what you want, you take pride in your ability to communicate and connect with others, and you’re always looking to improve.

You’re excited about 50-75% domestic travel.

You’re up for joining a small, fast growing firm. You have willingness and enthusiasm to learn new topics and be flexible in a rapidly evolving company and space. And you’re excited to go all in on crypto.  
It is the policy of Bitwise to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Bitwise prohibits any such discrimination or harassment.

job.title: System Administrator (m/f/div)
job.description:
For our Berlin office we are looking for a System Administrator with strong networking experience who is eager to learn and help us to share our next generation digital asset products.

We are building a team with diversity of thought and background—where everyone is encouraged to come up with new ideas to make our customers’ lives better.

Tasks

  • Maintain and grow internal infrastructure including, servers, routers, switches, firewalls, security updates; support internet, intranet, LANs, WANs, and network segments.
  • Build and maintain firewalls, VPNs, and site-to-site tunnels.
  • Monitor infrastructure health and respond to issues as they arise. Help build, test, and maintain servers as needed.
  • Research, analyze, implement and maintain new solutions for our infrastructure.
  • Proactively audit and test the flexibility, scalability, and resilience of the system, including our networks and backups.
  • Participate in on-call rotation to respond to critical system outage.

Requirements

  • At least 2 years of experience working as a Systems Administrator, Network Administrator, or DevOps Engineer.
  • You love CLI Linux systems (RHEL/CentOS, Debian).
  • Experience with networking and firewalls (pfSense, OpnSense, Smoothwall, IPCop, Cisco, or Ubiquiti; VLANs; iptables; tcpdump).
  • Experience setting-up secure (site-to-site) VPNs (ipsec, OpenVPN, BGP).
  • You can program in at least one of the following languages: python, bash, perl, java, C, C++.
  • You have excellent troubleshooting skills. You can look at a problem from different angles and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and dig into the unknown.
  • You are comfortable doing operational work that’s not automated in the beginning, but you proactively look for ways to unload the burden through automation and identify the point where efforts on automation stop bringing value.
  • Excellent communication skills in English with the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical teams – German and other languages are a plus!

Benefits

  • Diverse and inclusive team: We are from 10+ different countries with diversity of both thought and background on a mission to disrupt the digital asset industry. job.title: Risk & Compliance Officer
job.description:
Description

What is the role?

At Radix DLT, we are looking for a Risk & Compliance Officer. Working with our VP of Ops, you will help to define and continuously improve KYC and AML policies, processes, our ways of working and all potential risks that may arise. You will also support the junior member in the team, reviewing alerts of suspicious activity and transactions and run regular reviews of transaction data to identify any trends in behaviour.


What will you be doing?

  • Drafting and validating policies, procedures and guidance documents
  • Working closely with product teams to ensure all products and flows meet internal policies whilst ensuring a positive user experience
  • Owning the incident management and risk reporting framework, undertaking root causes analysis, leading lessons learned briefings and presenting process improvement recommendations
  • Continually monitor and review all developments within the regulatory environment and actively develop technical knowledge
  • Driving a commercial approach to compliance and a championing a pro-active compliance culture across the business and embedding strong working relationships
  • Assist with preparing regulatory reporting and correspondence across multiple jurisdictions
  • Act as Money Laundering Reporting Officer for our UK entity


What skills do you need?

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience within a risk/compliance related business functions
  • Extensive regulatory compliance experience, ideally gained within financial services, demonstrating strong knowledge of FCA/PRA regulations including but not limited to, SYSC rules, MIFID, COBS, Treating Customers Fairly, AML, and Payment Services Directive (PSD)
  • Detailed knowledge of anti-money laundering, counter-terrorist financing, and sanctions risks and regulations
  • A professional compliance, or financial qualification, and membership of a recognised professional body, would be advantageous but not a prerequisite.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Clear and concise communication, both written and verbal. This should include excellent report-writing and drafting capabilities
  • Be comfortable with operating in ambiguity and adapting to changing priorities

Who are we?

You’ve heard of Bitcoin (BTC) - the world’s first decentralized peer-to-peer digital money system - and Ethereum (ETH) - the decentralized computer for the world. Radix (XRD) builds on these concepts to deliver the decentralized infrastructure for global finance (aka decentralised finance, “DeFi”) with the Radix network.

At Radix, we're a team of like-minded thinkers who believe we’re at the earliest stages of a global financial revolution. DeFi is already enabling pioneering developers and entrepreneurs to re-invent almost every financial product that is currently traded and invested in traditional markets, without requiring central authorities or siloed infrastructure.

DeFi has grown assets under management from $1 billion to $100 billion in less than a year. Impressive as its growth has been, its current market size isn't even a rounding error on the over $111 trillion held in traditional finance. However, the current decentralized public ledgers DeFi is running on are hampered with fundamental challenges in scaling and parallelisation of transactions.

At Radix, we’ve gone back to first principles to develop the right technical solution—the first layer-one protocol built specifically for mainstream DeFi. Clearly the need for an infinitely scalable platform is only one prerequisite for mass adoption, so we're also blazing new ground in the areas of purpose-built developer tools, user experiences, and regulatory integration.

We're focused on delivering the technology to take DeFi from billions to trillions. We have forged a path deep into the future of what distributed ledger technology is going to look like. We need you to join the team to help bring this vision to reality.

If this job sounds like it was made for you, then please apply directly via the link or email farrah@radixdlt.com for more information.

job.title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
job.description:
Description

As an SDET at Radix, you will apply your boundless cunning to break distributed systems in new and interesting ways. You will study and emulate known attacks, and then concoct some new ones. You will make sure that happy path scenarios function as advertised, and that a massive array of potential error conditions all fail gracefully, predictably, and in a recoverable fashion.

During your first few months, your focus will be on creating automated tests verifying predictable pre- and post-conditions against a distributed, trustless system while coming up to speed on how the network operates and where the limitations are. With that understanding under your belt, you’ll start in on chaos testing and acting as a knowledgeable, malicious actor on our test networks.

Of course, you’ll also be contributing to test plans, highlighting gaps in coverage, creating regression tests to ensure fixed bugs stay fixed, and all the usual responsibilities of a test role. You’ll just have more fun doing those things, because we only hire fun and interesting people to work with. Your brain will bend in ways it wasn’t meant to be bent, you will form lifelong bonds with a team of incredible people, and you will forever remember the journey.

About You

  • Whenever you look at a specification or an API, your mind goes straight to the edge cases.
  • You’re a flexible coder and are confident in your ability to learn “enough to be dangerous” if you need to pick up a new language or tool.
  • If asked about a familiar product or system, you have no trouble describing the various sub-systems that contribute to its overall function.
  • You don’t get easily frustrated when trying to nail down difficult-to-reproduce issues. You are able to methodically narrow a bug investigation down to the critical elements.
  • You’re intelligent and you pick up new concepts quickly. A lot of what we do here is rolling back the boundaries of known space, and there’s no playbook to refer to.


What skills do you need?

  • At least 3 years in a quality assurance or development role for production software.
  • Experience building test automation frameworks. Can write such code from scratch.
  • Can integrate tests in CI, e.g., Jenkins.
  • Experience with load testing.
  • Familiarity with JVM languages, JavaScript, or Python.
  • Understanding or experience with BDD, TDD, or contract testing.
  • Docker and AWS experience is important.
  • Nice to have - experience with distributed systems.

About Us

At Radix, we're a team of like-minded thinkers who have long been convinced that we're living in the earliest stages of a global financial revolution. This revolution is being fuelled by decentralized finance (or DeFi for short), which is enabling an assortment of pioneering developers and entrepreneurs to re-invent almost every financial product that is currently traded and invested in traditional markets, without requiring central authorities or siloed infrastructure. DeFi has captured a great deal of attention and investment in the crypto-aware niche, growing assets under management to $90 billion in the last year. Impressive as its growth has been, its current market size isn't even a rounding error on the over $111 trillion held in traditional finance. We're focused on what it will take to go from billions to trillions.

Radix went back to first principles to come up with the right technical solution—the first layer-one protocol built specifically for mainstream DeFi—and we have already tested out at over 1 million transactions per second. We're keenly aware that the need for an infinitely scalable platform is only one prerequisite among many for mass adoption, and we're also blazing new ground in the areas of purpose-built developer tools, user experiences, and regulatory integration.

We have forged a path deep into the future of what distributed ledger technology is going to look like and we need you to come and be part of the team that is making that happen right now.

If this job sounds like it was made for you, then please apply directly or email farrah@radixdlt.com for more information.

job.title: Senior Lead Backend Engineer
job.description:
This role is currently remote as a result of Covid.  Will consider candidates from any USA location.  When safe to return to the NY office, where possible, local employees will be given the option for partial onsite return. 


Who we are 

 

We are a trusted, blockchain-native technology team that delivers leading products to address the most complex data challenges. We build SaaS solutions and data services to convert data into auditable information to support management, financial and regulatory reporting. Our products automate and optimize accounting, audit and tax processes for funds, fund administrators, OTC and proprietary trading firms, exchanges, miners, protocols and accounting firms - and we are proud to call some of the largest ones our clients.


Who we need

 

  • 8+ years of experience building, scaling and maintaining production services, and understanding of how to compose a microservice or serverless architecture in either Java or Kotlin
  • Capable of leading a small team (2-3 developers) and mentoring others
  • Strong understanding of OOP. Professional work experience with Functional Programming would be a plus
  • Solid understanding of REST services, gRPC
  • Proficiency with RDBMS (i.e. Postgres), various types of noSQL storage solutions
  • Experience in AWS infrastructure, Kubernetes, Kafka, JVM performance tuning would be a nice advantage 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Lead on project deliveries, determining work effort, being fully hands on, while also being able to delegate if necessary
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders from Product, Customer Success, and Engineering in order to deliver and enhance new and existing features of our flagship product Lukka Software Suite.  
  • Build and maintain application software for ingesting and standardizing large amounts of transactional data from external media, including APIs and file uploads. Will require performance tuning, memory management, and implementing rate limiters.
  • Build core components which cover critical flows including integration with external systems and internal services responsible for data reconciliation.  
  • Work with senior team members to contribute planning, coding, testing and releasing your work
  • Coach and mentor team members and be accountable for their development
  • Achieve on-time delivery without compromising quality
  • Hit the ground running and be a full-fledged contributor to the corresponding project/team within 6 months


Why Join Lukka?


Are you looking for a challenge? Lukka solves the most complex data and technology challenges for an industry that is at the forefront of innovation.


At Lukka, we strive to anticipate and respond to the needs of this new and ever-changing ecosystem of digital assets. That was true in 2014, while everyone was focused on trading & buying this new asset class, we were thinking about the tax implications of crypto. That innovative foresight continues today as we evolve and iterate on our product suite to address the regulations and educate our customers.


We are looking for passionate, collaborative, and strategic individuals who want to help shape the future of, well, everything – starting with making crypto more accountable. We invest in our teammates, promote from within & are responsible to each other by fostering an inclusive space for curious minds to thrive and innovate.


What are some common reasons our team members enjoy working @ Lukka? 


  1. Ability to own the projects they work on
  2. Less red-tape to take ideas from inception to delivery
  3. Being at the forefront of an industry
  4. Small team, big dreams


What’s life @ Lukka like? 


We move fast and continue to be ahead of the curve. You could be part of a growing company bridging the gap between business and blockchain. 

Here’s some insight into why our team members have joined:

  • Ability to own the projects they work on 
  • Less red-tape to take ideas from inception to delivery
  • Being at the forefront of an industry
  • Small team, big dreams


Of course, let’s discuss some perks:


  1. Health and Dental insurance covered at 100% for employees and 70% for dependents
  2. Flexible PTO - burnout is a real thing, we encourage all employees to get out and recharge
  3. Generous Parental Leave - Your growing family is important to you and thus important to us
  4. We work in a rapidly growing industry and we need to also constantly grow. We can’t stay ahead of the curve if we aren’t learning. Every employee is given an annual learning allowance and encouraged to use it
  5. We want you for the long haul. We’re a team on a mission and we want you to grow your career with us. Promoting from within is not just something we say, but something we do
  6. Hard work is rewarded at Lukka. Our recognition programs are designed with you in mind – we provide free crypto to all new employees for learning purposes
  7. Team events - recent nights have included kickboxing, game night, and happy hour!
  8. In-office Fitness Studio - whether you want to lift, meditate or pedal it out on our Peloton; you’ve got the ability to do so


So you’ve scrolled, your interest is piqued and hopefully read all of the important things...now what? 


This is an exciting time to join a team that’s at the forefront of this rapidly growing industry. We are looking for people who constantly push themselves to think differently, are ready to face new challenges and chart exciting new paths. If this excites you, apply now!

job.title: Frontend Engineer
job.description:
Build user interfaces that save people money


About Greenwood Labs

The majority of protocols in the decentralized finance (DeFi) industry focus on making money for crypto lenders. We're on a mission to save money for crypto borrowers.

Greenwood is DeFi's first borrowing aggregator. Our protocol reduces the interest that crypto borrowers pay on their loans by originating loans with the least expensive lending protocol, and automatically refinancing loans when a lower interest rate is available.

We handle the complexity of integrating with, and comparing interest rates across, the ever-growing number of decentralized lending protocols to deliver a simple, protocol agnostic, interface for borrowing crypto.

Our team is backed by some of the world's best investors and operators who support our team in delivering a world-class product.


About the Frontend Engineer role

We are looking for an experienced, design-obsessed, frontend software engineer to help us build the next generation of the Greenwood Protocol. You will gain ownership over our existing suite of web products, as well as the ability to influence the creation, design, and execution of future products. You will be responsible for ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience across borrowing interfaces, analytics pages, documentation portals and more.


What you'll achieve

  • Create trustworthy user experiences that are simple, intuitive, and reliable

  • Build, test, and ship user-facing code using modern practices, including reusable components and frontend libraries

  • Create wireframes, mockups, and high-fidelity designs, and translate them into high-quality code

  • Work closely with Smart Contract Engineers to connect UI elements to Greenwood protocol contracts


Skills/Requirements

  • A deep understanding of the architecture of modern client-side React applications

  • Proven experience in implementing web frontend projects using React stack: React, Redux, JavaScript, CSS

  • Experience with interface design tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe)

  • Experience designing products from mockup to completion

  • Basic understanding of Git commands

  • Basic understanding and experience working with Web3

  • Portfolio showcasing your user-obsessed design work and coding abilities


Nice to have

  • Passion for DeFi and/or crypto

  • Familiarity with the Web3 frontend stack (web3.js, ethers.js, etc.)

  • Knowledge of TypeScript paired with React/Redux

  • Experience with Solidity or Vyper

  • Degree in computer science


Tools we use

  • React/Redux

  • TypeScript

  • web3.js/ethers.js

  • Figma


Greenwood welcomes all qualified persons to apply regardless of race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Compensation will be competitive and commensurate with experience. This is a full time role which includes health insurance and other benefits.


Apply for the job

Do you want to join the Greenwood team as our new Frontend Engineer? Then we'd love to hear about you!
