job.title: Test Automation Engineer (m/f/div) Germany and/or Portugal
job.description:
Job description

We are looking for an experienced Test Automation Engineer to join our team. As a Test Automation Engineer you will take full ownership of the quality of our Finoa banking system. Starting from the system and user requirements you are going to develop and execute automation scripts to confirm the quality of the code we develop.

  • You will collaborate closely with Developers and the Product Team to understand the functionality and implement features that need to be tested and automated.
  • You will continuously look for improvements in our test management, execution, and reporting tools to keep up with Finoa’s growth.
  • You will develop scripts to run automated tests using postman.
  • You will share QA status updates with the tech teams at daily meetings and take ownership in interlinking the test reports with the release requirements.
  • You will organise and manage all phases of the software testing process.
  • You will be responsible for writing documentation for processes, including test plans, test procedures, and test cases.
  • You understand that test automation is key to a sustainable QA system in a growing environment and you are going to work hands-on in API testing.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science (or Master) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in developing high-performance back-end systems, websites and cross-platform mobile apps.
  • Strong hands-on experience with Core JAVA. Selenium, TestNG, Extent Reports.
  • Experience in API test automation using Postman__.__
  • Have had experience in performance testing using JMeter and/or K6.
  • Experience with SQL is strongly desired; working experience with GraphQL is a plus.
  • Good understanding of advanced testing concepts in scalability testing and security testing.
  • Good understanding of test management, test automation reporting tools.
  • You have an agile mindset and have a strong sense of ownership, flexibility, and initiative.
  • Excellent communication skills in English with the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical teams – German and other languages are a plus!

Why you should apply

  • Diverse and inclusive team: We are from 20+ different countries with diversity of both thought and background on a mission to disrupt the digital asset industry. We support each other and take pride in our achievements. We attract talents from companies like Google, N26, SumUp, Goldman Sachs, Moonfare, and McKinsey.
  • Ownership & learning-curve: Opportunity to shape the future financial system, promoting a more equal and innovative society. We encourage shared responsibility through distributed leadership while sharing success and learning from mistakes.
  • Communication: We treat our staff like owners by being open, transparent, and providing regular communication about our direction and progress. We provide regular insights into decision making, strategy, and company-wide OKR progress so that each of our employees is aligned and empowered. We are also always aiming to improve how we can communicate more effectively.
  • Office: We offer both the flexibility to work remotely or to work in style and comfort from our modern office at Checkpoint Charlie, the heart of Berlin.

Finoa is an equal opportunity employer devoted to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

job.title: Head of Developer Ecosystem
job.description:
Description

What is the job?

We are looking for an ambitious Head of Developer Ecosystem who wants a new challenge in one of the most exciting growth industries in the world: DeFi (Decentralised Finance).

In the middle of November of this year a ground breaking new programming language for DeFi, Scrypto, was previewed to the world by Radix. Over 6,000 people tuned in to watch the live demonstrations.

Your role will be to strategise and execute a well funded and global multi-year plan to turn the Radix DeFi dev community from the small passionate tribe it is today, into something world beating. Scrypto is your secrete weapon, the Radix community is your platform, rebuilding the global financial system the target market for the community you empower.

We believe that Decentralized Finance is the biggest developer opportunity since the internet itself, but it is a revolution on pause largely due to the immaturity of current platforms and tools for developers.

Right now DeFi developers and entrepreneurs have a problem: everything is built on Solidity, a programming language that was never intended for decentralized finance. So while the DeFi industry has grown from $1Bn to over $270Bn under management in less than two years (yes, really), it has had $300M+ in hacks and smart contract exploits over the same period. And the pool of good Solidity developers is tiny due to the complexity of learning how to build even the simplest functionality safely.

The problem sits right at the heart of how DeFi is built today. At Radix, we thought that should change. Radix exists to be a developer-first platform. Everything we have done to date in building our technology has been informed by our long work in the crypto space, and talking with the leading decentralized finance developers and projects in the space.

Scrypto is built around an entirely new asset-oriented paradigm of development that finally gives DeFi developers what they need: making build, test, and iteration cycles short; massively reducing the complexity of safe management of digital assets; and helping get new developers from DeFi curious to DeFi competent quickly and effectively. Scrypto deeply leverages Rust, but adds new capabilities specifically for finance in a public decentralized network environment.

But technology alone isn’t enough. Central to Radix’s success is building a groundswell movement of developer adoption that may start small, but is self-sustaining, organic, and exponential in growth. You will be responsible for building a community and ecosystem of developers that support, educate and help each other to succeed using Radix and Scrypto as the enabling technologies for their success – from a small existing core developer community to one of thousands and onward to millions.

Using your know-how in building and growing passionate global communities of developers, you will formulate a practical, concrete community-first strategy closely linked with our product and marketing strategies for 2022 and beyond. You will of course want to learn all there is to know about our developer tools, our platform roadmap, and our vision. You will get to know our existing developer community as well as today’s chaotic DeFi industry. Your job will be to take these technology tools and community foundations and build a team and a movement of builders by planning and driving the right combination of developer events both physical and virtual, social channels, technical support and documentation, and other programs of your devising.

This will not be easy - so much of the future of this industry is still unwritten - but this is your chance to help write an entirely new chapter around what is possible with community-driven financial applications and decentralized finance.

Listen to our CEO and CPO talking about Scrypto, DeFi, and the importance of developer community: https://youtu.be/Hn20w1gmpMw?t=340


What are we looking for?

  • You have previously built a community of developers that has expanded to take on a life of its own - or you’ve been a front lines to witness the birth of a successful community and have learned the secrets of success
  • You thrive on finding and initiating new ways to seed and support new flashpoints of enthusiasm and community growth
  • You are a builder - you don’t want to just talk about tech, you write code because that’s the only way to understand first-hand the needs of developers
  • You are a communicator, able to convey to a developer audience why they should care about the tech in terms that resonate deeply with them
  • You believe in the power of open source development to create great things and serve as a hub for communities, and know how successful open source projects are run
  • You understand that while we must invest in our community, the goal is a self-sustaining movement fueled by personal enthusiasm, fun, and a belief in long-term opportunity - not just bounties, prizes, and dev funds

What skills do you need?

  • Proven experience in creating and running impactful community developer meetups, hackathons, workshops, and other events, physical and virtual
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, and comfortable with community interaction on channels like Discord and Telegram
  • Practical development experience - either professional or open source contribution
  • Rust or smart contract programming experience a plus

Who are we?

At Radix, we're a team of like-minded thinkers who have long been convinced that we're living in the earliest stages of a global financial revolution. This revolution is being fuelled by decentralized finance, which is enabling an assortment of pioneering developers and entrepreneurs to re-invent and improve almost every financial product that is currently traded and invested in traditional markets, without requiring central authorities or siloed infrastructure. DeFi has captured a great deal of attention and investment in the crypto-aware niche, growing assets under management from $1 billion to $270 billion in less than two years. Impressive as its growth has been, its current market size isn't even a rounding error on the over $300 trillion held in traditional finance. We're focused on what it will take to go from billions to trillions.

Radix went back to first principles to come up with the right technical solution—the first layer-one protocol built specifically for mainstream DeFi—and we have already tested out at over 1 million transactions per second. We're keenly aware that the need for an infinitely scalable platform is only one prerequisite among many for mass adoption, and we're also blazing new ground in the areas of purpose-built developer tools, user experiences, and regulatory integration.

We have forged a path deep into the future of what distributed ledger technology is going to look like and we need you to come and be part of the team that is making that happen right now.

In return for working with us, you get to work remotely on your own schedule (or the option to get a local co-working space if preferred), work at the cutting edge of new technology and benefit from an education budget to use to further develop your skills!

If this job sounds like it was made for you, then please apply directly via the link or email farrah@radixdlt.com for more information.

Requirements

Benefits

job.title: Senior Web Developer
job.description:
Who we are

PowerTrade is a fast growing crypto trading platform for trading crypto options and other crypto derivatives. Our Android and iOS Apps are live in the respective App Stores, and offer a mobile- first trading experience that’s designed to be simple, fast and focused on trader success.

Our community is what keeps us focussed and dedicated to delivering our best. PowerTrade not only offers a mobile-first crypto options platform, but has also designed the PTF DAO token which governs a treasury covering traders in black-swan events. We want traders to be successful and do everything we can to educate and inform the trading community of opportunities in crypto.

About The Role

We are looking for a Senior Web Developer to build the next-generation cryptocurrency platform.
Senior Web Developer responsibilities include leading a team of junior and mid-level developers, refining web-related specifications and resolving technical issues.

To be successful in this role, you should have extensive experience building realtime products such as trading applications, video games, chat apps or any other high throughput applications with websockets or gRPC.

Previous experience in FinTech/Financial Services and crypto would be an advantage, but curiosity, experimentation and empathy for the user experience would be most important. If you have experimented with webassembly, smart contracts, or have used emerging technologies in interesting ways, you'll thrive in our environment.

Job Duties
  • Identify user and system requirements for new applications.
  • Prioritize software development projects, set timelines and assign tasks to team members.
  • Create wireframes to decide on layout.
  • Write or review code for various applications.
  • Run functionality testings and debug code.
  • Oversee junior/mid-level web developers and evaluate their performance.
  • Liaise with designers to decide on UI/UX elements.
  • Ensure all software documentation is up-to-date.
  • Collaborate with vendors, mobile and back-end developers to build mobile-responsive websites.

    • Our Ideal Candidate
  • An inordinate amount of common sense.
  • Extensive work experience as a Senior Web Developer.
  • Expert knowledge of javascript and HTML/CSS to create delightful experiences and animations.
  • Experience with mockup and UI prototyping tools.
  • Deep understanding of security practices (OWASP, etc.).
  • Interpreting client specifications and identifying platform user requirements.
  • Identify trade-offs and make critical decisions based on technical and business requirements.
  • Creating timeframes and work schedules to meet (and beat) deadlines.
  • Communicating effectively with clients, teams and Senior Management.
  • Updating records and writing reports (standard discipline).
  • Debugging and ensuring software documentation is updated and current.
  • Liaising and syncing with mobile and backend developers.
  • Establishing strong professional relationships with clients and other professionals.
  • Supervising junior web developers, analyzing areas of weakness, and scheduling training sessions as appropriate.
  • Willingness to work overtime when required.
  • Superb interpersonal, and written and verbal communication skills.
  • Passion to perform, and willingness to innovate and succeed.
